data.text: If you put a wool sweater through the laundry, it shrinks.

data.text: So why don’t sheep, which are, you know, basically made of wool, why don’t they shrink

data.text: The answer comes down to friction.

translation.text: Câu trả lời đi xuống ma sát.

data.text: of each fiber.

data.text: These scales make it easier for the fiber to slide in one direction than the other,

data.text: When a wool - or human hair - sweater gets thrown into the washing machine and tossed

data.text: around, this one-way resistance becomes a problem, because, as each fiber rubs against

data.text: in one direction.

data.text: The water makes things worse, both by causing the fibers to swell, which brings them into
